message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We conducted a study using the World Development Indicators dataset to investigate the impact of foreign aid on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the Global Burden of Disease Study to examine the effect of air pollution on human health.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease Study"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Living Standards Measurement Survey and the Demographic and Health Survey to study the determinants of child malnutrition in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Survey", "Demographic and Health Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "In this research, we use a combination of survey and biomarker data from the Demographic and Health Survey and the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey to assess the nutritional status of women and children in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey", "National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Doing Business report and various other sources, we investigate the relationship between businesses' access to finance and their productivity.", "dataset": ["Doing Business"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Global Terrorism Database and the Armed Conflict Location and Event Data Project to investigate the relationship between terrorist attacks and violence against civilians in conflict-affected countries.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database", "Armed Conflict Location and Event Data Project"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the impact of public-private partnerships on infrastructure development, we use data from the Private Participation in Infrastructure database and the World Bank's Public Investment Management database.", "dataset": ["Private Participation in Infrastructure", "Public Investment Management"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the International Energy Agency and the World Bank to analyze the factors that influence renewable energy development in developing countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a combination of household survey and administrative data on farmers and agribusinesses from the International Food Policy Research Institute to evaluate the effectiveness of agricultural subsidies in reducing poverty.", "dataset": ["International Food Policy Research Institute"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the impact of water scarcity on economic growth using a dataset on freshwater resources from the United Nations Environment Programme and macroeconomic data from the World Bank's World Development Indicators.", "dataset": ["United Nations Environment Programme", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Water", "Macroeconomics"]}]
